definition: to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
ghost of a person who died by hanging/hanged person/(coll.) inchworm/hangman (word game)
don't insist on only taking one road to Rome (idiom)/there's more than one way to skin a cat
pinyin: bu4 yao4 zai4 yi1 ke1 shu4 shang4 diao4 si3

definition: to grieve for the sick and the dying/to show great concern for people's suffering

sentences.english: One he can hang if the friend's father should displease him?
sentences.chinese: 一个当她父亲触怒他的时候可以被吊死的朋友？

sentences.english: Hanging pirates from the yardarm is so 18th-century.
sentences.chinese: 在18世纪你可以把海盗系在桁杆上吊死。

sentences.english: So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.
sentences.chinese: 犹大就把那银钱丢在殿里，出去吊死了。

sentences.english: The idiots who decided agent orange was a good idea, should be hung.
sentences.chinese: 那些认为使用橙剂是个好主意的人应该被吊死。

sentences.english: His hanging face, like a devil's sick of sin;
sentences.chinese: 他的一张吊死鬼的脸，就像恶魔一样可怖。

sentences.english: The king's soldiers took the poor man away and hanged him.
sentences.chinese: 国王的士兵把那个可怜人拖出去吊死了。

sentences.english: As well be hanged for a sheep as (for) a lamp.
sentences.chinese: 与其为一只小羊羔不如为一头大羊去吊死。

sentences.english: Hanging up dead rats by their tails wards off the plague.
sentences.chinese: 用老鼠的尾巴把它吊死就可以避免瘟疫。

sentences.english: And he cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, and departed, and went and hanged himself.
sentences.chinese: 犹大就把那银钱丢在殿里，出去吊死了。

sentences.english: Driven to desperation, my grandfather hanged himself on a tree beside our ancestral graves.
sentences.chinese: 被逼得无路可走，我祖父在祖坟旁的一棵树上吊死了。

sentences.english: Damn, these guys really need to hang it up.
sentences.chinese: 该死，这些家伙真该吊死。

sentences.english: The happiest shoppers are people who aren't hung up on money or things.
sentences.chinese: 最快乐的购物者不会让自己吊死在金钱或物质的树上。

sentences.english: If you have a bad name, you are half-hanged.
sentences.chinese: 一个有了坏名声的人是一半早就吊死了。

sentences.english: Conservative people recommend this option to avoid pigeonholing yourself.
sentences.chinese: 保守派建议这种方式，以免让自己在一棵树上吊死。

definition: to hang (i.e. execute by hanging)/to strangle
to nail securely/to execute by means of impalement/to crucify
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to parade (a prisoner) through the streets
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
